newsitem.title: CHINA: China yet to pick Three Gorges generator suppliers.
newsitem.headline: China yet to pick Three Gorges generator suppliers.

text.p: China has yet to decide on the foreign group that will supply generators to the Three Gorges hydroelectric project, an official of the China Yangtze Three Gorges Development Corp said on Monday.
China is reviewing tenders from several consortia to supply the generating units and had planned to select the winning bidder by late June or early July, officials have said.
"Meetings and discussions are going on," an official told Reuters by telephone from central Hubei province's Yichang city. He declined to give further details.

The groups in the running include Siemens AG and GE Canada; Anglo-French group GEC Alsthom; Swedish-Swiss group ABB Asea Brown Boveri ; a Russian consortium; a Japanese group; Impsa of Argentina; and a Canadian unit of Westinghouse Electric Corp, official media has reported.

The huge hydropower and water conservation project, which will dam China's Yangtze River, will use 14 generating units with a total installed capacity of 9,800 megawatts. It is scheduled for completion in 2009.
